steps: If using dried chickpeas, soak overnight in plenty of water; drain before using. For canned chickpeas, skip to step 4
Add soaked chickpeas and 2.5 cups water to Instant Pot
Close lid and cook on high pressure for 15-20 minutes; allow natural pressure release for 10 minutes, then quick release remaining pressure
Open lid and drain excess liquid, reserving 1 cup of cooking liquid
Set Instant Pot to saut√© mode and heat ghee or oil
Add cumin seeds and let sizzle for 30 seconds until fragrant
Add diced onion and cook until softened and golden, about 5-7 minutes
Add ginger, garlic, and green chili; cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes
Add chana masala spice blend, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, and salt; stir and cook for 1 minute
Return cooked chickpeas to pot with 1/2-1 cup of reserved cooking liquid
Use back of spoon or potato masher to lightly mash some chickpeas to thicken sauce
Simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens and chickpeas are well-coated
Turn off heat and stir in lemon juice and garam masala
Serve garnished with fresh cilantro, alongside rice or naan
title: Chana Masala
